ai-mil3.1.10:1.2_0: “Reverend Sir, what is the characteristic of faith?”
ai-mil3.1.10:1.3_0: “Considering the confidence of others is character.”
ai-mil3.1.10:1.4_0: “Sir, how does confidence come to be?”
ai-mil3.1.10:1.5_0: “Clearly, great king, when the mind is ready, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, settled, and decided.
ai-mil3.1.10:1.6_0: That’s how confidence comes to be.”
ai-mil3.1.10:2.2_0: “As a wheel-turning monarch was traveling with a fourfold army, with the army of four divisions, and the water would set out rolling the water. And the elephants, horses, chariots, and the waters of the chariot would become full.
ai-mil3.1.10:2.3_0: King Uttiya, the king’s callste; ‘I will enjoy rice; I’ll enjoy a water-pot, and drink it.’
ai-mil3.1.10:2.4_0: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ they’d do as he were told.
ai-mil3.1.10:2.5_0: Then the wheel-turning monarch would drank water.
ai-mil3.1.10:3.1_0: Like this, great king, like this can be seen like that.
ai-mil3.1.10:3.2_0: As far as the water of the earth is set up a water jar in water, it would fall into a trunk, a crumbling as it’s muddy, let it go to the water, oil, honey, and swep the cracks.
ai-mil3.1.10:3.3_0: In the same way, when it comes to the hindrances, a mind without hindrances, joyful, and confident, settled, and decided.
ai-mil3.1.10:3.4_0: That’s how confidence comes to be.”
ai-mil3.1.10:5.1_0: Questioning the confidence of others, the tenth (perfection):
